item.title: A Call to Chapel with Rev. William H. Lamar, Jeremiah A. Wright, Jr. Spiritual Leader - In - Residence at Cramton Auditorium
item.description:
Sun, 18 Jan 2026

William H. Lamar IV is pastor of Metropolitan African Methodist Episcopal Church in Washington, DC. He previously served congregations in Monticello, Florida; Orlando, Florida; Jacksonville, Florida; and Hyattsville, Maryland.

Lamar was the managing director of Leadership Education at Duke University Divinity School in Durham, North Carolina, from 2008 to 2011. Through his association with Duke, he convened and resourced executive pastors of large churches, denominational finance executives, young denominational leaders, Methodist bishops, and the constituency of Lilly Endowment’s Sustaining Pastoral Excellence Program.

To learn more about our guest speaker, click here

View on site | Email this event

item.title: Research Month Call for Abstracts at Blackburn Center (Armour J. Blackburn University Center)
item.description:
Sun, 18 Jan 2026

We are pleased to invite you to participate in Howard University Research Month 2026 by submitting your research abstract for the Annual Research Symposium, the premier showcase of scholarly and creative work across our campus community!

This year’s Research Symposium will take place April 30 – May 1, 2026, at the Armour J. Blackburn Center, featuring both oral and poster presentations across a wide range of disciplines including Biological & Biomedical Sciences, Physical Sciences & Engineering, Humanities, Social Sciences, Environmental Studies, Business, Creative Arts & Design, Education & Outreach, and Translational & Clinical Sciences.

All abstracts must be submitted electronically by 11:59 p.m. on Sunday, February 15, 2026.

Submitting an abstract is a wonderful opportunity to highlight your research, engage with peers and mentors, and contribute to the vibrant intellectual community at Howard University. Whether you are an undergraduate, graduate student, postdoctoral scholar, faculty member, or staff researcher, we encourage you to share your work and be part of this dynamic celebration of discovery! Howard University Research Month

Submit your abstract and find more details at: https://researchmonth.howard.edu/

View on site | Email this event

item.title: National Harbor Jack & Jill x HU School of Education MLK College Readiness Day of Service at Miner Building (Myrtilla Miner Building- School of Education)
item.description:
Mon, 19 Jan 2026

The Howard University School of Education, in partnership with the National Harbor Chapter (NHC) of Jack and Jill, is proud to host the 2026 MLK Day of Service, continuing a cherished tradition of community engagement, youth empowerment, and collective service in honor of the enduring legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. This event is FREE and OPEN to the PUBLIC.

The day will begin with a complimentary continental breakfast, followed by a warm welcome from the NHC Chapter President and the Howard University Interim Provost, and an opening prayer to set a reflective and purposeful tone. The program will feature a keynote presentation by Dr. Shawn Joseph, Interim Superintendent of Prince George’s County Public Schools, who will highlight college readiness initiatives and share insights on the wide range of academic and career-preparation opportunities available to middle and high school students across the district.

The program will then transition into a dynamic panel discussion for parents focused on financial planning and resources to support families in preparing for the cost of college, particularly in light of the evolving federal financial-aid landscape. While parents are in, children will engage in one of three thoughtfully designed breakout sessions, each tailored to support students and families at different developmental stages:

College Readiness for High School Students, led by Howard University undergraduate studentsGavel Club / Speech Preparation Workshop for middle school students, exploring the principles of public speaking through the words and leadership of Dr. KingThe MLK “I Have a Dream” Room, where younger children will create MLK-inspired thank-you cards for teachers at Howard University Middle School

In addition to these learning experiences, youth volunteers will lead hands-on service projects, including assembling school-supply boxes for Howard University Middle School and stocking the snack pantry at the Howard University School of Education to support college students with nutritious study snacks.

Through education, service, and intergenerational collaboration, the 2026 NHC MLK Day of Service will once again create meaningful impact while honoring Dr. King’s vision of service, unity, and opportunity for all.

View on site | Email this event

item.title: MLK Day Classic - Howard Men's Basketball vs Morehouse College
item.description:
Mon, 19 Jan 2026

Join us for the Annual MLK Day Classic as our Howard Bison take on the Morehouse Maroon Tigers at Burr Gymnasium on Monday, January 19. This isn’t just a game—it’s a celebration of legacy, Truth and Excellence, and service. Rooted in Howard University’s enduring commitment to academic distinction, leadership, and social responsibility, this matchup honors Dr. King’s vision by uniting competition with purpose.

In that spirit, Howard University is proud to partner with Martha's Table for a Community Service Food Drive, honoring Dr. King’s commitment to uplifting and serving others. For more than 40 years, Martha’s Table has supported neighbors throughout Washington, D.C., providing access to healthy food, education, and opportunity.

Fans are encouraged to bring the following items to support this effort:

Beans and lentils (dry or canned)Canned vegetables (low sodium) and canned fruit (packed in water or juice)Coffee and teaCanned or frozen turkey, chicken, and salmonWhole grain crackers, low-sugar cereal, and rolled oatsDried fruit, applesauce, low-sugar oatmeal, and breakfast barsPasta and tomato sauceItems may be dropped off upon entry to Burr Gymnasium.

Together, let’s honor Dr. King’s legacy by showing up with purpose—on the court, in the stands, and in service to our community.

View on site | Email this event
